ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: Question 1: the course is a discussion and explanation of the readings

The course needs at least a few assignments to help bring the material together or otherwise help think about it. Reading a paper and then not really getting past the paper in class was not all that helpful. A different model (with a more stringent economics pre-req) could be a reading course with more readings and a directed and deep discussion as the class. This would serve more advanced students well, but at the expense of the intermediate students.

Mendelsohn does not seem to care about this class. He never bothered to send the class one email or one classesV2 announcement. This was particularly frustrating when class was canceled on a snow day. He said he tried to send something a few times, but never bothered to figure out how to actually do it until after the very last day of class we got our first classesV2 announcement (to announce the final makeup location) He needs a TA if nothing else but to communicate with us. He gave very little direction on the final paper. I stopped reading half way through the class, and it didn't actually matter because the final exam ignored the entire second half of the class. Sometimes you need an easy class to balance the schedule - thats part of the reason I took this class. And it was a success by that valuation method. However, it would have been nice if Mendelsohn would have at least appeared to have cared.
The professor should use slides for this class. This will give him structure and a backbone from which he can follow to stay on topic and speed.
readings were interesting but a little outdated. need more regular assignments. would be helpful to do a brief intro and review of regression
This is an interesting course with potential, but the lack of homework assignments and hands-on work with actual data made it difficult to really understand the material that was covered
This course would have been more useful if it had assignments and hands-on activities.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Successfully learning the varying methods to value the environment, obtaining a platform to think about the environment from an economics' perspective
The valuation tools would be useful if the method of instruction was improved, but it was hard to care when he didnt care.
Minimal work load
interesting readings and useful concepts to value the environment.
I appreciated the structure of the class of introducing students to the major valuation techniques. I do feel like I could talk generally about the merits and drawbacks of specific techniques.
The project proposal/paper was the best aspect of the course - it enabled students to apply what they had learned to an issue they cared about.
I really enjoyed learning about the various valuing techniques. I think that these techniques were very useful for my career.
The readings were good. Good to read primary literature about different valuation studies.
The wide range of methods on how to measure the environment values and rich literature.
I think I have gotten a pretty good understanding of the major techniques used to value the environment, so overall I would say that the goal of the course was achieved.
The content is very interesting.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: A more participatory aproach will greatly beenfit the class. It need to strike the right balance between a lecture and a seminar class.
Use articles and methods that are more recent

Assignments are needed without question. Particularly on the CV sections, they all seemed to run together and the nuances and purposes of the different study types were sometimes lost on me. Powerpoint could be very helpful for some of the supply/demand curves and other graphical descriptions.
See my response to question 13. -needs a TA -more clarity -more organization -come to class on time -come prepared -care
Clarification of concepts in class, course structure
need more regular assignments and problem sets. need to use real data in the regression equations to better understand how to do the valuation.

Though I appreciated being introduced to different valuation techniques, the professor very abstractly went through the mechanics of carrying out the valuation and provided no opportunity for students to develop skills using the techniques. The only assignments for the class were a midterm and final, which had students explain each technique and the advantages and disadvantages of each, and a paper where we simply had to propose a technique to value an environmental resource. I was very surprised that this being a graduate level class never required students to develop a marginal benefit and cost curve, nor actually find data (or at the minimum use provided data) to carry out a valuation. For some students that don't have a background in stats or econ this may be a challenge. However, this being an upper level grad course there is the expectation that students already taken Intro to Stats and Intro to Environmental Econ. Further, we are in grad school and should be challenged and provided the opportunities to learn the skills that a client that wants to hire one to conduct a valuation should know. Opportunities also exist for practicing and cementing other skills in the class. For example, when talking about survey design for a willingness to pay survey, have students develop a short survey and have the professor or peers critique the way questions are worded and structured. I would find this to be more beneficial than abstractly discussing how to create a survey.

Giving several assignments throughout the semester would have helped students better understand the material. Also, using power points or other visuals may have helped during lectures to keep students engaged. Lastly, having a TA weekly discussion section would have been a good forum for students to ask more in depth questions.

I think this course needs to have more hands-on activities that use the techniques. These could culminate in a semester project or presentations at the end of each section. I really enjoyed the final paper and think that more activities such as this would be very helpful.

Lacked structure. No TA no slides. Hard to follow the instructor sometimes. Don't feel like I took away anything from the course. There needed to be a technical component to the course - perhaps a group project or some econometric analysis.

Course should be more dynamic; papers more recent; there should be assignments on how to apply the methods we see in class and read from the papers; the course should provide basic instructions on how to deal with econometrics, regression and other types of calculations that we deal with when read the papers; if it's not possible to cover some basics on regression, it might be helpful to have econometrics as a pre-requisite, as well as statistics.

The course really needs more structure and thorough planning. Any, most importantly, it needs quantitative homework assignments. Without actually practicing the techniques discussed in class, I don't think we could ever really apply them effectively.
Needs more hands-on activities, group-work etc

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: No lab sections
No discussion section, but I think that having one would be very beneficial.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: part of the course that related to valuing land and recreation were more useful than how to value the damage of climate change

Regardless of whether one believes it is appropriate to put a price tag on environmental services, policy and land planning decisions rely on valuing the benefits of such decisions and investments. Thus I consider a course like this is important for environmental managers.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I'm interested in economic approaches to environmental conservation and I think the valuation of ecosystem services is a key tool to inform decision makers and overall environmental management.
To have an easy course and to learn some econ. It was easy. I learned a little econ.
thought it would be interesting and valuable to learn how to put a quantitative value on environmental benefits.
I took this course to better understand how economists value the natural resource of the environment. I believe that I have learned much more in detail about the travel cost and other methods.
Because my focus is on environmental finance and economics.
The content is super interesting.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes, however, I'd have liked to have more hands-on experience with at leat some of the techniques. I think that, for instance, the benefit transfer could have been relatively easy to assign as homework, and it would have given us some experience using software like Invest or Aries.
Yes, but I would have liked to have a more up to date perspective.
No. It was hard to pay attention to Mendelsohn's unstructured approach.
no
learned a broad range of tools that can be used to value the environment

This course helped me understand different types of valuation techniques available. However, I took this course so that I would be able to carry out (not merely propose) an actual valuation. I do not feel equipped to do that. Certainly, one course would not provide a student with learning all the nuances for carrying out a valuation. However, that should not preclude providing a more hands on and implementation focus on valuing the environment within the course.
I would have gained more if I had the opportunity to use actual data.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Take an economics course before

Question the syllabus and see if the professor has improved it to include the suggestions from previous years. Does it include assignments, for starters? And consider what you're looking to get out of it. This course could be immensely useful to the right person and I think some structural tweaks will make it easier to get more material from the course. But if you're looking for a filler class, your head might wander a little bit.
Do not expect a great class. Do expect an easy class. On average throughout the entire semester I probably spent 1.5 hours per week (including the many hours I spent studying and the final paper)
This is no substitute for a real economics course
focus on take home messages instead of the small details of each valuation technique. think about final project proposal early and meet with professor mendelsohn to brainstorm. review regression.

The professor indicated that he plans to structure the course differently in future years. However, if it follows the same structure as this year I would instruct students who are interested in mainly learning (but not executing) different valuation techniques to take the course.
I would recommend taking econometrics and statistics before taking this course to fully understand the equations and necessary information for valuation.
Do the readings and begin the final paper with enough time to explore different methods and new literature.
Talk to the professor about the format of the course.
